intro: Chenopodium berlandieri var. zschackei, commonly known as pigweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Chenopodium berlandieri var. zschackei is a common weed in the United States and is known for its rapid growth and adaptability.
